description:
runtime: revert of CL 8852047: do hashmap grow work during reads.
seems to break freebsd-386.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://khr%40golang.org@code.google.com/p/go/

On 2013/06/01 04:42:35, khr wrote:
> Hello mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com,
> 
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://khr%2540golang.org%40code.google.com/p/go/

LGTM. In the future please use hg undo.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=1f7fdf4ad92d ***

runtime: revert of CL 8852047: do hashmap grow work during reads.
seems to break freebsd-386.

R=golang-dev, dave
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/9915047

I tried hg undo, it crashed halfway through.  Not my day, apparently.  But
it left the undo in my client, so I made a regular CL out of it.


On Fri, May 31, 2013 at 9:44 PM, <khr@golang.org> wrote:

> *** Submitted as
> https://code.google.com/p/go/**source/detail?r=1f7fdf4ad92d<https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=1f7fdf4ad92d>***
>
>
> runtime: revert of CL 8852047: do hashmap grow work during reads.
> seems to break freebsd-386.
>
> R=golang-dev, dave
> CC=golang-dev
> https://codereview.appspot.**com/9915047<https://codereview.appspot.com/9915047>
>
>
> https://codereview.appspot.**com/9915047/<https://codereview.appspot.com/9915047/>
>

Aww crap, never mind. Thanks for jumping on this so quickly, you and
dmitry havent' had much luck recently.

On Sat, Jun 1, 2013 at 2:45 PM, Keith Randall <khr@google.com> wrote:
> I tried hg undo, it crashed halfway through.  Not my day, apparently.  But
> it left the undo in my client, so I made a regular CL out of it.
>
>
